pr_title: Fix slow and contented local cache restart

timeline.bodyText: Will this part be performant enough if there are a large number of extra pages? Is there any way to parallelize or otherwise delete the rest of the stream at once after we detect the metastore is out of space?
timeline.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText:
removed the warning but show the aggregated result in the end.
there is no easy way to bulk-delete the files after metastore is filled
replies.author: apc999

timeline.message: Fix slow and contented local cache restart
Fix slow and contented local cache restart

timeline.bodyText: Should this be a write lock because we might delete the page if there is not enough space?
timeline.author: calvinjia

timeline.bodyText: Is this description accurate? It looks like we only have two states?
timeline.author: calvinjia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -938,6 +950,12 @@ public MetricKey build() {
           .setMetricType(MetricType.COUNTER)
           .setIsClusterAggregated(false)
           .build();
+  public static final MetricKey CLIENT_CACHE_STATE =
+      new Builder(Name.CLIENT_CACHE_STATE)
+          .setDescription("State of the cache: 0 (NOT_READY), 1 (READ_ONLY) and 2 (READ_WRITE)")

timeline.bodyText: One concern here is if multiple threads can go into restoreOrInit.
timeline.author: calvinjia

timeline.bodyText: Are we guaranteed create is only called once? Otherwise we could queue up multiple restoreOrInit
timeline.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText: also made a few methods synchronized to further ensure this
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: If restoreOrInit hasn't completed, is it safe for get calls? Will there be some objects which could be null?
timeline.author: calvinjia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -18,7 +18,35 @@
 /**
  * Interface for managing cached pages.
  */
-public interface CacheManager extends AutoCloseable  {
+public interface CacheManager extends AutoCloseable {
+
+  /**
+   * State of a cache.
+   */
+  enum State {
+    /**
+     * this cache is read only.
+     */
+    READ_ONLY(0),

timeline.author: calvinjia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -938,6 +956,12 @@ public MetricKey build() {
           .setMetricType(MetricType.COUNTER)
           .setIsClusterAggregated(false)
           .build();
+  public static final MetricKey CLIENT_CACHE_STATE =
+      new Builder(Name.CLIENT_CACHE_STATE)
+          .setDescription("State of the cache: 0 (NOT_IN_USE), 1 (READ_ONLY) and 2 (READ_WRITE)")

replies.bodyText: I feel 0,1,2 is more friendly for monitoring? my would go with 0, 1, 2
replies.author: apc999

replies.bodyText: Yeah I agree, but is that how the value works in the code, doesn't the Metric.STATE counter initialize at 0?
replies.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText: ah you are right. Let me update the state transition.
replies.author: apc999

timeline.message: Use trylock since LocalCacheManager.create can be slow now

timeline.bodyText: Should this be return -1 not sure if this counts as error or page not found?
timeline.author: calvinjia
